title: A Bodoni equivalent?
content:
Hi all, does anyone know of a good font similar to Bodini? I'm looking for a nice extended modern style typeface to play with preferable with thick stems

Cheers!
author: monkey.butter

comments.content:
Hi Rus,  
1. It’s Bod **o** ni, you Didiot! [sorry, really no offence intended – just couldn’t deny myself [that stupid pun](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023164339/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Didone) ;^}]  
2. There are hundreds of different [Bodonis](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023164339/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=Bodoni)  
3. [Bodoni](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023164339/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Bodoni)

F

… and to add something more tangible:  
There is a list with a couple of cool (fat) modern faces in this [thread on typographica.org (2nd paragraph)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023164339/http:/typographica.org/001062.php).  
F

Great thanks for those! I'm sure I'll find something there as some of those fonts are gorgeous.

And don't worry, I have my keyboard on my lap when writing this as my head is hung so low with shame with misspelling Bodoni! That'll teach me not to check what I've written! ;-)
Wasn't Bodini Fred's competition for Ginger's affections in _Top Hat?_
